item.description:
Hello all!  This FREE event is posted on behalf of Yutaka Tanno. Please get there a bit early since seating is limited to 60 people.

Date: Tuesday, April 10th

Time: 12:30 PM - 2PM

Location: 
Harvard University
Bowie-Vernon Conference Room, Knafel Building, 2nd Floor (Room N262)
1737 Cambridge Street, Cambridge, MA 02138

Map: http://www.wcfia.harv...

Speakers:
Prof. Susan J. Napier, Tufts University, author of "Anime: From Akira to Howl's Moving Castle "
Prof. Ian Condry, MIT, author of "Hip-Hop Japan: Rap and the Paths of Cultural Globalization"

Ian will be speaking mostly about giant robot anime, touching on Astro Boy, Mazinger Z, Gundam, Evangelion, and Code Geass (though focusing primarily on Gundam).
Susan will likely be talking about her forthcoming book on anime fans and the parallels with other waves of foreign interest in Japan from impressionism on.
Space may be limited (room holds about 60).

The seminar is free and open to the public. 
Sponsored by the Program on US-Japan Relations (co-sponsored by the Reischauer Institute).
For more info: http://www.wcfia.harv...
item.name: Japanese Anime and the Global Imagination
